lines.text: Hawkins, pack my grips, we're going ashore this evening.
What d'yer mean by staying out so long. What d'yer think I keep yer for?
Say, matey, wouldn't the boss like some nice fresh fish?
I knew it, sir. This is a bad place, sir. It has a lady ghost.
If you find her, Hawkins, introduce me.
No sir, not a drop today, sir.
Your bathing suit is gone. It must be that bally ghost, sir.
Hawkins, our ghost has been taking a bath.
Let me see whether you're real flesh.
That's your ghost, Hawkins. Isn't she pretty?
The girl was as beautiful as a rose -...
Cupid lurks in the shadows of the big living room.
She is only an ocean waif whom I am protecting.
Is kissing part of the protection?
I trust you will accept Mr. Robert's affection paternally. We are to be married you know.
Slick looking kid. She's a woman now and I ain't her father.
Now you know as I ain't your father, suppose you and me goes and gets married?
